title: Olivia Attwood turns up the heat in a semi-sheer lace top and skintight leather trousers
text:
She has made a dramatic addition to the TOWIE cast.

And Olivia Attwood turned up the temperature as she arrived at Molly-Mae Hague's Beauty Works launch at Menagerie restaurant in Manchester on Thursday.

The reality star, 28, looked seriously sexy in a semi-sheer lace dress which offered a glimpse of her busty assets as she posed for snaps at the star-studded bash.

Stunning: Olivia Attwood turned up the temperature as she arrived at Molly-Mae Hague's Beauty Works launch at Menagerie restaurant in Manchester on Thursday

The reality diva teamed her top with a pair of skintight leather trousers, showcasing her endless svelte pins which she teamed with a pair of gold hoop earrings.

The Love Island star wore her platinum locks in loose tumbling curls, while opting for a glamorous coat of make-up including a heavy bronze smokey-eye and glossy lip.

Olivia's appearance comes after her explosive row in Marbella with Courtney Green where Olivia tried to fling a plate of olives at her and called her a pygmy goat.

However, Olivia received plenty of support from TOWIE fans as they watched her come face to face with Courtney, 24, to discuss their bad blood.

Killer look: The reality star, 28, looked seriously sexy in a semi-sheer lace dress which offered a glimpse of her busty assets as she posed for snaps at the star-studded bash

One viewer wrote: @oliviajade_att has truly saved towie'.

Another fan said: 'I love @oliviajade_att she's made TOWIE this season. I don't think she has anything to apologise for. You can only be pushed s far until you [sic] blow.

'She's only human and she reacted exactly how any other girl would of reacted but the only difference is she had a camera following her.'

In the argument, Olivia accused Courtney of being a liar after Courtney claimed Olivia had called her a pig during their Marbella bust up.

Olivia said: 'Courtney, you are a liar. I never called you a pig, I called you a little goat.'

Not impressed, Courtney responded: 'You think that's any better, calling me an animal, a goat? Do you think that's any better?'

Praise: The sighting of Olivia comes days after her explosive row in Marbella with Courtney where Olivia tried to fling a plate of olives at her and called her a pygmy goat

Olivia replied: 'Courtney, you did get aggressive. You did clap your hands in my face.'

Courtney insisted Olivia's words to her were unacceptable and said: 'Because you were threatening me, that you were going to drag me down and put up a noose by my head. I have to protect myself.'

Olivia told her she was confused, saying: 'No, I meant like go shopping. You misunderstood it.'

Showdown: However, Olivia received plenty of support from TOWIE fans as they watched her come face to face with Courtney, 24, to discuss their bad blood

Chloe Meadows, Clelia Theodorou and Amber Turner also got involved in the dispute.

After another few minutes of arguing, Olivia relented and acknowledged she had lost her temper but told Courtney she should not have called her 'trash'.

Olivia said: 'Look, I'm sorry for losing my temper. I'll put my hands up and say I was out of line, straight.

'But when you called me trash, you called me a trashy mess, I've been through s**t in my life. You wouldn't know that but that word for me is a trigger and it just gets me in a place and I just lost it.'
